intro: Euphrasia saxatilis, commonly known as the rock eyebright, is a perennial herb native to rocky and alpine regions of Europe. It typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as limestone cliffs and gravelly soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers with two lips, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia saxatilis is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
